physical_examinations.relevant_findings: At 2.5 months, low serum insulin and C-peptide concentrations with glucose concentrations above 200 mg/dL (11 mmol/L). Hemoglobin 8.9 g/dL, neutrophils 1380 per mm続, platelets 17,000 per mm続. High serum titers of antibodies against GAD65 and pancreatic islets. Ichthyosis present.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weight fell below the third percentile as intractable diarrhea continued; required total parenteral nutrition., Ichthyosis observed two weeks after birth worsened to widespread exfoliative skin eruption before improving with treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Hemolytic anemia diagnosed with IgG autoantibodies. Lowest blood neutrophils: 1380/mm続, platelets: 17,000/mm続, hemoglobin: 6 g/dL. Cholestatic hepatitis also noted.
Notable findings include no evidence of infectious agents; blood counts showed improvement. Blood glucose control improved, insulin therapy stopped.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Autoantibodies against pancreatic cells no longer detected by day 180; normalization of hemoglobin and platelets observed.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal intestinal biopsy; normal mucosa; mild eczematous skin lesions noted, treated with corticosteroid cream.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Eczematous lesions improved rapidly with treatment.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal weight, height, and hematologic functions.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Stable mixed chimerism found; patient showed normal progression in feeding and overall well-being.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Developed fever, splenomegaly, lymphadenopathy, elevated liver enzymes, and thrombocytopenia.
